author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: بَيْنَ النَّارِ وَالنُّورِ وَالنَّفْيِ وَالإِثْباتِ بِأَنْ تُنَزِّلَ عَلَيَّ وَمَنْ مَعِي مِنْ أَحِبَّائِي خَيْرَ الدُّنْيا وَالآخِرَةِ، ثُمَّ ارْزُقْنَا مِنْ بَدائِعِ نِعَمِكَ المَكْنُونَةِ وَإِنَّكَ أَنْتَ خالِقُ البَرِيَّةِ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ العَزِيزُ المُتَعالِ.
translation: I entreat Thee, O my Lord, by Thy Most Great Name whereby Thou didst separate light from fire, and truth from denial, to send down upon me and upon such of my loved ones as are in my company the good of this world and of the next. Supply us, then, with Thy wondrous gifts that are hid from the eyes of men. Thou art, verily, the Fashioner of all creation. No God is there but Thee, the Almighty, the All-Glorious, the Most High.
